page.title: 19Yesterday and Today
page.content: I interviewed my mam, who went to school during the Second World War. She told me that she could remember many children in school having scarlet fever. There were no{computers}and sometimes they would write with{chalk {on a slate. } At home they had no proper bath and on bath nights she got bathed in a{tin {bath}which was hung on a nail in the backyard. There were no automatic washing machines and her mother used to use a{'poss stick'}in a large tub and then put the clothes through a hand{mangle}to remove the surplus water. She can remember using an{air raid {shelter}under the Imperial grounds and listening to tales about 'Galloping Harry' who rode through Hall Park grounds with his head under his arm.
